data.text: As we commemorate International Holocaust Memorial Day 75 years after the liberation of Auschwitz, we must all stop, pause, reflect &, most importantly, pledge to continue teaching current & future generations about these horrors, so that it never, ever happens again. #HMD2020 https://t.co/cEn9Wd0FRD

Great to host a reception on early diagnosis as @AlzResearchUK President at @Davos this week. Dementia is one of the biggest global challenges - and we will only crack it by detecting it sooner #MakeBreakthroughsPossible https://t.co/6dnQJJKwHL

Huge congratulations to @BorisJohnson and all those @Conservatives candidates who worked so hard. An extraordinary and powerful result. Full statement below. #GeneralElection2019 https://t.co/6n64grHUj7
Remember to vote today - and to #VoteConservative #GeneralElection19 https://t.co/27lYHwkIW3
I want to wish all @Conservatives candidates the best of luck tomorrow after a hard-fought #GeneralElection19 campaign and urge everyone to go out there and #VoteConservative

Great to meet with the British Chamber of Commerce Singapore @britchamsg to discuss opportunities for UK trade and business in the Asia Pacific region and to bang the drum for British business in APAC. #SGUKpartnership 🇬🇧🇸🇬 https://t.co/xWMFTUk3hW

Delighted @Conservatives have pledged to double funding into dementia research, building on the PM’s Dementia Challenge I launched in 2012. Thanks to vital research, we’re moving closer to a life-changing treatment - this could make all the difference. #VoteConservative #GE2019 https://t.co/PRY9hwhEkl

It is the gravest responsibility as Prime Minister to send our brave servicemen & women into potential harm’s way; & the most immense privilege to honour their sacrifice. On Remembrance Sunday, on Armistice Day, & every day, we will remember them. #LestWeForget  #ArmisticeDay https://t.co/g5ZPHNdwco
Great to get out campaigning today with @AlokSharma_RDG - urging Reading West to vote @Conservatives on 12 December!  #VoteConservative  #GE2019 https://t.co/29F0ySaj6L

Heartfelt commiserations @EnglandRugby, but you can hold your heads high after a terrific and well fought tournament - we're proud of you. And many congratulations @Springboks; great final and thoroughly well-deserved victory. #RWCFinal #ENGvsRSA

I am so proud Britain kept its promise to the poorest in the world by spending 0.7% of national income on overseas aid. Great to see the difference that commitment is making in countries like Bangladesh https://t.co/8NxASI5gvm
With a simple retweet you can help @AlzResearchUK make dementia the next big medical success story. You can change the future. #ShareTheOrange https://t.co/RS3fGJQlmd

Proud to have been John Humphrys' final 'subject' on @BBCr4today. Thank you John for 32 years of striking the fear into politicians like me every morning, asking us the questions we don't always want to answer and calling us to account. It's an amazing record. #HumphrysLastDay https://t.co/OZVdtKCD4L
My take on my life and my political career, For the Record is out today. #ForTheRecord https://t.co/EYpUv5SmWW

For 3 years I have kept relatively quiet about politics. But I think it’s right former PMs write their memoirs, to explain what they did and why. For the Record is out Thursday. Serialisation starts in today’s @thetimes  https://t.co/rsFKeY4jSV

Delighted to join @MattHancock and Jay Flatley from @illumina at the Int'l Summit on Population Genomics. Buoyed by the global enthusiasm to utilise genomics to inform diagnosis and prevention of disease - and proud to show how our own NHS with @GenomicsEngland is leading the way https://t.co/GbzUB4VYk5
I know how difficult today’s decision must have been and I wish @RuthDavidsonMSP and her family all the best for the future 2/2

When I called for more non-political people to get involved in politics in 2009 I couldn't have dreamed of a better candidate than @RuthDavidsonMSP. Her brand of fearless, forthright Conservatism has transformed our party in Scotland and we owe her an enormous debt... 1/2
Really proud to see this investment by @TheDDFund. Proof of how far dementia drug discovery has come since we launched the Fund in 2015. #MakeBreakthroughsPossible   https://t.co/uIv4PCKJ5g
5m people taking part in this initiative is fantastic news for British science and for beating dementia - and it is only possible because we have an NHS https://t.co/OiqDyMlq45

Congratulations @BorisJohnson on becoming our Prime Minister. It is a great privilege & responsibility - but behind that famous black door you will find the most hugely talented officials waiting & wanting to help you serve the country; I wish you well.
Massive congratulations to @englandcricket - what a finish; what a tournament!! Well done to everyone involved. WORLD CHAMPIONS at last - it's come home! #CWC19 https://t.co/faRcoUSxzA

Fascinating visit to @ARUKnews Oxford Drug Discovery Institute today - a brilliant example of how collaboration in dementia research is fast-tracking development of new treatments. #MakeBreakthroughsPossible https://t.co/aePM15JI6S

Commiserations to our brave #Lionesses - but huge congratulations for an amazing @FIFAWWC. You have not only entertained & enthralled a nation, but inspired countless girls & women the country over to take up sport & give it their all. We are proud of you!

Uplifting, affectionate and truly splendid Service of Thanksgiving for the extraordinary life and work of Baroness Trumpington today at St Margaret’s Church, Westminster Abbey. Jean would have loved it! https://t.co/7G3gOA4jJh

Huge honour and privilege to join Jeremy Heywood's family, friends, colleagues, and Prime Ministers past and present, at @wabbey today, to pay tribute to a wonderful, kind, brilliant and thoroughly good man: https://t.co/3q1MYooQYJ

Fascinating visit to @CDCgroup this week to learn about their brilliant work supporting development through investment in many of the world’s poorest & most fragile countries. They are leading the way, transforming economies, businesses & lives. #investmentworks https://t.co/C5xt5gV7UJ

.@NCS helps bring young people from different backgrounds and communities together. Great to sit down with @HMC_Org and @GDST schools today and discuss how to ensure young people, from all walks of life, come together to take part. #unstoppabletogether https://t.co/IjZC39fa9a

On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day Landings, we give our profound & humble thanks to the greatest generation: the heroes who fought & gave their all - in many cases, their lives - for future generations. They gave their tomorrow for our today & we must never forget. #DDay75 https://t.co/sozWkcMVTv

So sad to hear the news that Michael Spicer has passed away. We first met when we both worked with Cecil Parkinson. He had a great sense of fun and humour as well as being devoted to his family, constituency and Parliament. I will miss him.
Strong and brave speech by a Prime Minister driven by duty and service… she should be thanked for her tireless efforts on behalf of the country. Full statement below. https://t.co/4XpEZIzrxh

I set up the Holocaust Commission to answer Britain's need for a permanent museum and memorial to the darkest chapter in human history. PMs past and present explain why that is vital, and why it should be next to Parliament, at the heart of our democracy https://t.co/zc1sSlAbz3
Heartfelt congratulations to The Duke and Duchess of Sussex on the arrival of their baby boy. Such wonderful and happy news! Sending love and very best wishes

Congratulations to all Conservative councillors elected today, and heartfelt commiserations to those who have lost their seats. Politics is a tough business sometimes, but you are dedicated public servants who can be proud to have represented your local community.

Vote @Conservatives before 10pm for...

✅ Lower Council Tax ⬇️
✅ Greener councils with better recycling services 🌳
✅ Better local services

#VoteConservative
RT @DementiaRev: Every step, every mile, every cheer...all of it has made an incredible difference for people like Sue who are living with…
Good luck to the incredible @DementiaRev runners who are leading the charge towards a cure for dementia at the @VirginMoney #LondonMarathon this weekend! https://t.co/dAc0cFXJ0H

Lots of emotions visiting @GreatOrmondSt, the amazing place Sam and I spent so much time with our son, Ivan. So encouraging to see the strides being made in genomics and paediatric neurology, and the Zayed Centre for Research into Rare Disease in Children, opening soon. https://t.co/mAlGZZAnE8

Horrifying news coming from New Zealand; a sickening attack on peaceful worshipers. My thoughts & prayers are with all those affected & with the people of NZ. We must cont to stand united against hatred & extremism. Let’s celebrate our diversity to show that this evil cannot win.
Sad that three talented Tory MPs have left the party… I respect their decision, but disagree with them. https://t.co/YwkHVvB82d

Very sad to hear that Charles Farr has passed away. A kind and thoughtful man and a pleasure to work with, he was a loyal civil servant, providing invaluable service and expertise to government and was committed to keeping our country safe and secure. https://t.co/HlSfNTMrtk

Delighted to address the #DFIForum at the @BlavatnikSchool yesterday to discuss how, with increased cooperation, development finance institutions can be more effective in some of the world’s most fragile & conflict-affected areas. Thanks to co-hosts @The_IGC, @IFC_org & @CDCgroup https://t.co/mScXhjoxDr

Great to see @NCS in action in Yorkshire this week. Fun NCS assembly, talking to students about the benefits of social action. Then a visit to @YCCC_YCF to discuss their community action, excellent academy and the potential for delivering NCS programmes. https://t.co/yjWfi22ymn

Fascinating meeting in New Delhi with India’s Principal Scientific Adviser, Prof VijayRaghavan, @InvestIndia & @Illumina to discuss India’s genomics mission & the potential genomics could bring to India, building on our own work with @GenomicsEngland & the #Genomics100k project. https://t.co/5MFxWU9J5d

Great to visit @TheOxfordTrust’s new Science Centre #StansfeldPark. With running costs paid for by providing office space for science & tech start-ups, the Centre will teach local school children, inspiring them on the wonders of science, while also helping firms develop & grow.

As I said at the time, "If we fail to act, we are looking at an almost unthinkable scenario where antibiotics no longer work & we are cast back into the dark ages of medicine”. I’m proud of the UK’s continued commitment to global leadership on AMR. #AMR #AntibioticResistance 2/2

I fully support the introduction of a 5 year action plan to tackle AMR & preserve antibiotics for future generations, as announced by @DHSCgovuk & @MattHancock today, building on the work of The Review on AMR that I commissioned in 2014. 1/2 https://t.co/6G4BXBkLU0

tweets.text: Exclusive: Health Secretary @MattHancock commits to doubling annual #dementia research funding to £166m a year to spearhead the search for a cure. @Conservatives would plough more than £1.66bn over the next decade to hunt for the holy grail of medicine #GeneralElection2019 https://t.co/KQhC5txIJs
I spent the day in the refugee camps in Cox's Bazaar, Bangladesh seeing first hand the difference #UKaid and @UKinBangladesh is making. Here's a thread of what I found. 1/ https://t.co/VramRfWt1v
David Cameron was John Humphrys' final interview for #r4today #humphryslastday https://t.co/uuOW6LbEf9

Excited to see this effort to revolutionise how we diagnose dementia & other conditions progress. We look forward to sharing details soon about how we’re working to identify the diseases that cause dementia 10-15 years before symptoms appear. @beisgovuk 

https://t.co/cxJPzRQBVh

The Prime Minister and the four living former Prime Ministers - Sir John Major, Tony Blair, Gordon Brown and David Cameron - give their full backing to the new National Holocaust Memorial and Learning Centre @10DowningStreet @UKHMF https://t.co/59EtreDClO

Every step, every mile, every cheer...all of it has made an incredible difference for people like Sue who are living with dementia.

Thank you so much to our amazing #LondonMarathon runners - we couldn't be more grateful for everything you've done! https://t.co/r03qB3WIwZ
Sedwill and May lead tributes after national security chief Charles Farr dies: https://t.co/edlRtz5RKg https://t.co/8G9wX5V07j

Every year in the UK 2,000 people die due to drug resistant infections. Today at #wef19 @MattHancock unveils the UK's new five year action plan to tackle this global threat and preserve antibiotics for generations to come #AMR #AntibioticResistance https://t.co/AE9lKwfXlZ
